dct:title: Miami-Dade Qualified Opportunity Zones
dct:creator: Miami-Dade County
Florida

dct:description: A polygon feature class with all population census tracts designated as Qualified Opportunity Zones (QOZs) as well as all population census tracts originally eligible for designation as a QOZ for purposes of 1400Z1 and 1400Z2 of the Internal Revenue Code (the Code). To identify areas designated as Qualified Opportunity Zones (QOZs). An Opportunity Zone is an economically-distressed community where new investments, under certain conditions, may be eligible for preferential tax treatment.
prov:action:
#########
# GDSC ETL is performed in two steps: shell script to ETL data into postgres
# and then additional transformations with SQL in postGIS (if needed).
####

#########
# Step 1 - bash script (pseudo code)
####

# create directory structure and move into it
mkdir -p /data/mdc_qualified_opportunity_zones/{download,etl} && cd /data/mdc_qualified_opportunity_zones

# set update flag based on last update and update frequency
do_update=0 if date() < last_update + update_frequency else do_update = 1

# download if update flag is set:
if do_update == 1 then
  wget -O download/mdc_qualified_opportunity_zones.json 'https://services.arcgis.com/8Pc9XBTAsYuxx9Ny/arcgis/rest/services/QualifiedOpportunityZones_gdb/FeatureServer/0/query?outFields=*&where=1%3D1&outSR=4326&f=geojson'

# replace column names Shape__Length and Shape__Area to avoid conflict when
# providing as service on ArcServer.
sed -i 's/Shape__Length/shape_length/gI; s/Shape__Area/shape_area/gI' download/mdc_qualified_opportunity_zones.json

# load into postGIS with:
  ogr2ogr -lco GEOMETRY_NAME=geom -f PostgreSQL PG:"<postgres connection>" download/mdc_qualified_opportunity_zones.json -nlt multipolygon -nln mdc_qualified_opportunity_zones

#########
# Step 2 - SQL script (pseudo code):
####

# remove duplicate points and make geometries valid:
UPDATE mdc_qualified_opportunity_zones
  SET geom=ST_MakeValid(ST_RemoveRepeatedPoints(geom));"

# add local geometry column and reproject existing geometries into local EPSG:
SELECT AddGeometryColumn (
  'mdc_qualified_opportunity_zones',
  'geom_local',2236,'multipolygon',2
);
UPDATE mdc_qualified_opportunity_zones
  SET geom_local=ST_MakeValid(ST_RemoveRepeatedPoints(ST_Transform(ST_Multi(geom),2236)));
CREATE INDEX mdc_qualified_opportunity_zones_geom_local_idx
  ON mdc_qualified_opportunity_zones
  USING GIST (geom_local);
NOTIFY pgrst, 'reload schema';"cd /data/mdc_qualified_opportunity_zones/
mkdir -p derived
# Create pg_dump and downloadable zip of table in derivate directory 
pg_dump -d $POSTGRES_DB -U $POSTGRES_USER -p $POSTGRES_PORT -h postgis-2k0dg34uilke6ctl -t mdc_qualified_opportunity_zones > derived/mdc_qualified_opportunity_zones.sql
tar -czf derived/mdc_qualified_opportunity_zones.sql.tar.gz meta_dcat_mdc_qualified_opportunity_zones.json -C derived mdc_qualified_opportunity_zones.sql
dcat:contactPoint: University of Miami Libraries, Frost Institute for Data Science and Computing
gdsc:label: namelsad10
gdsc:attributes: geoid10;Census Track identifier; a concatenation of 2010 Census state FIPS code, county FIPS code, and census tract code;Census;string;
name10;Census tract name, this is the census tract code converted to an integer or integer plus two-digit decimal if the last two characters of the code are not both zeros;Census;string;
namelsad10;2010 Census translated legal/statistical area description and the census tract name;Census;string;
intptlat10;2010 Census latitude of the internal point;Census;string;
intptlon10;2010 Census longitude of the internal point;Census;string;
pop100;100% population count for the zone;string;
hu100;The 100% count of housing units for the zone;Census;string;
p0020006;Black or African American population alone;Census;integer;
p0020007;American Indian and Alaska Native population alone;Census;integer;
p0020009;Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander population alone;Census;integer;
p0020011;Population of two or more races;Census;integer;
